qas.question: In what period did Emperor Kammu rule?
Who did Kammu fail to conquer?
What was the full title for Shogun?

context: In the <a0_0>early Heian period<a0_0/>, <a1_0>the late 8th and early 9th centuries<a1_0/>, Emperor Kammu sought to consolidate and expand his rule in northern Honshū, but the armies he sent to conquer the rebellious <a2_0>Emishi<a2_0/> people lacked motivation and discipline, and failed in their task.[citation needed] <a4_0>Emperor Kammu<a4_0/> introduced the title of <a3_0>sei'i-taishōgun<a3_0/> (征夷大将軍) or Shogun, and began to rely on the powerful regional clans to conquer the Emishi. Skilled in mounted combat and archery (kyūdō), these clan warriors became the Emperor's preferred tool for putting down rebellions.[citation needed] Though this is the first known use of the "Shogun" title, it was a temporary title, and was not imbued with political power until the 13th century. At this time (the 7th to 9th century) the Imperial Court officials considered them merely a military section under the control of the Imperial Court.
